intro: Costus stenophyllus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf costus, is a tropical plant belonging to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces striking, pale yellow to orange inflorescences. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense clumps, making it a popular ornamental plant. Botanically, it is characterized by its aromatic foliage and unique floral structure, which attract various pollinators.
